intro: Trema cannabina var. scabrum, commonly known as the rough trema, is a variant of the trema plant characterized by its rough, textured leaves. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a distinctive waxy coating. The flowers are small and clustered, often hidden within cup-like structures called cyathia.
